page.title: 03WOODLANDS VILLAGE
page.content: Woodlands village has changed considerably since about 195O. For instance better roads have been built and nowadays most families have at least one car. There were once four small shops in the village, now there is only one which is owned by Mr. and Mrs. Pullinger. The only pub in the village is the Royal Oak where as there used to be the Cricketer's Arms which is now closed down. Many years ago Woodlands House belonged to General Sir Richard Lee now it is used as an old people's home. Another main feature of Woodlands is Woodlands Farm. This was once known as Home Farm because whole families would live and work there, but now it is a stud farm. Most people who live here work away from the village and commute backwards and forwards each day.
